item.title: Simone Biles: 'I blame system that enabled Larry Nassar abuse'
item.description: Four Olympic gymnasts blast the FBI for failing to act on their complaints about the USA team doctor.

item.title: UK, US and Australia launch pact to counter China
item.description: The partnership will enable Australia to build nuclear-powered submarines for the first time.

item.title: Paris attacks trial: Abdeslam blames France for bombing IS
item.description: Salah Abdeslam shocks his trial, describing the bomb and gun attacks as "nothing personal".

item.title: Afghanistan: Life under Taliban rule one month on
item.description: Secunder Kermani looks at life in northern Afghanistan, four weeks after the militants seized power.

item.title: North and South Korea test ballistic missiles hours apart
item.description: The tests highlight an arms race on the peninsula, as nuclear talks with North Korea remain stalled.

item.title: Alex Murdaugh: The hot shot US lawyer and the hit man
item.description: Months after his wife and son were found dead, police say a lawyer arranged a hit - on himself.

item.title: Afghanistan women's youth soccer team escapes to Pakistan
item.description: Their departure comes as part of a wider exodus of female stars after the Taliban takeover.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban deputy denies reports of leadership row in new video
item.description: Mullah Abdul Ghani Baradar had disappeared from view amid reports of a row between Taliban leaders.

item.title: Australia's Curtin University wants 'unethical' AI study retracted
item.description: The Australian university says the facial recognition study co-funded by China breached guidelines.

item.title: Covid-19: Pope puzzled about vaccine hesitancy in the Church
item.description: Pope Francis says most people at the Vatican are vaccinated except for a "small group".

item.title: EU must step up and build defence - von der Leyen
item.description: The Commission's chief says the EU needs the "political will" to intervene militarily without the US.

item.title: Saudi Arabia camel carvings dated to prehistoric era
item.description: A new study suggests the sculptures in Saudi Arabia are far older than previously thought.

item.title: Mexico drug lord 'The Viceroy' sentenced to 28 years
item.description: Vicente Carrillo Fuentes took control of the Juárez cartel after his brother died in a botched operation.

item.title: Three ex-US intelligence officers admit hacking for UAE
item.description: The three men allegedly helped a UAE-based firm break into computers and phones around the world.

item.title: Canadian prairie ranchers struggle with drought conditions
item.description: Amid a severe drought in the Prairies, some ranchers are trying to find ways to work with nature.

item.title: On the trail of fake medicine smugglers in Benin
item.description: Since the beginning of the pandemic, there’s been an increase in counterfeit drugs around the world.

item.title: Hushpuppi - the Instagram influencer and international fraudster
item.description: How Nigerian Ramon Abbas went from a romance scammer to a so-called "Billionaire Gucci Master".

item.title: When Nazis tried to trace Aryan race myth in Tibet
item.description: Heinrich Himmler sent a team of five Germans to Tibet in 1938 to pursue the Aryan race myth.

item.title: Mangrove forests: Photography winners show beauty of ecosystems
item.description: The Mangrove Photography Award winners show unique ecosystems above and below the waterline.

item.title: Canada federal election: Canadians want reconciliation. Will the election deliver?
item.description: The issue that seized Canadians for much of the summer has mostly been absent on the campaign trail.

item.title: Iranian musician risks prison for new album
item.description: Mehdi Rajabian made an album in secret in his basement despite threats from Iranian authorities.

item.title: Miss Ireland 2021: First black winner 'proud' of crown
item.description: Pamela Uba moved to the country as a seven-year-old - now she's making history after taking the title.

item.title: Covid: Which countries are vaccinating children and why?
item.description: Millions of children around the world are being offered a Covid vaccine.

item.title: Why even giant ships can't solve the shipping crisis
item.description: A shortage of vessels is hampering global trade and may lead to empty shelves before Christmas.

item.title: Ros Atkins on... why people are using a horse drug
item.description: Ivermectin is being used by some to treat Covid-19, despite the benefits being unproven.

item.title: The homemakers breaking taboos on Instagram
item.description: Vasanti, Ritu and Pradnya, who have overcome huge challenges, now find joy performing on social media.

item.title: Russian elections: Meet the politicians barred from the ballot
item.description: Ahead of this week's elections many opposition candidates have been prevented from running.

item.title: Pakistan: How to cool Karachi as temperatures rise
item.description: In Karachi, Pakistan, one entrepreneur is on a mission to plant urban forests to cope with rising temperatures.

item.title: Met Gala 2021: Which celeb shone brightest on the red carpet?
item.description: After skipping last year because of coronavirus, celebrities went all out in the fashion stakes.
